verses.text: A good name \add is\add* better than precious ointment ; and the day of death than the day of one’s birth. \p
¶ \add It is\add* better to go to the house of mourning , than to go to the house of feasting : for that \add is\add* the end of all men ; and the living will lay \add it\add* to his heart.
Sorrow \add is\add* better than laughter : for by the sadness of the countenance the heart is made better.\f + \fr 7.3 \ft Sorrow: or, Anger\f*
The heart of the wise \add is\add* in the house of mourning ; but the heart of fools \add is\add* in the house of mirth.
\add It is\add* better to hear the rebuke of the wise , than for a man to hear the song of fools.
For as the crackling of thorns under a pot , so \add is\add* the laughter of the fool : this also \add is\add* vanity.\f + \fr 7.6 \ft crackling: Heb. sound\f* \p
¶ Surely oppression maketh a wise man mad ; and a gift destroyeth the heart.
Better \add is\add* the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: \add and\add* the patient in spirit \add is\add* better than the proud in spirit.
Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry : for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.
Say not thou, What is \add the cause\add* that the former days were better than these? for thou dost not enquire wisely concerning this.\f + \fr 7.10 \ft wisely: Heb. out of wisdom\f* \p
¶ Wisdom \add is\add* good with an inheritance : and \add by it there is\add* profit to them that see the sun.\f + \fr 7.11 \ft good…: or, as good as an inheritance, yea, better too\f*

For wisdom \add is\add* a defence , \add and\add* money \add is\add* a defence : but the excellency of knowledge \add is, that\add* wisdom giveth life to them that have it.\f + \fr 7.12 \ft defence: Heb. shadow\f*
Consider the work of God : for who can make \add that\add* straight , which he hath made crooked ?

In the day of prosperity be joyful , but in the day of adversity consider : God also hath set the one over against the other, to the end that man should find nothing after him.\f + \fr 7.14 \ft set: Heb. made\f*

All \add things\add* have I seen in the days of my vanity : there is a just \add man\add* that perisheth in his righteousness , and there is a wicked \add man\add* that prolongeth \add his life\add* in his wickedness.
Be not righteous over much ; neither make thyself over wise : why shouldest thou destroy thyself?\f + \fr 7.16 \ft destroy…: Heb. be desolate?\f*
Be not over much wicked , neither be thou foolish : why shouldest thou die before thy time ?\f + \fr 7.17 \ft before…: Heb. not in thy time?\f*
\add It is\add* good that thou shouldest take hold of this; yea, also from this withdraw not thine hand : for he that feareth God shall come forth of them all.
Wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighty \add men\add* which are in the city.
For \add there is\add* not a just man upon earth , that doeth good , and sinneth not.
Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken ; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee:\f + \fr 7.21 \ft take…: Heb. give not thine heart\f*
For oftentimes also thine own heart knoweth that thou thyself likewise hast cursed others. \p
¶ All this have I proved by wisdom : I said , I will be wise ; but it \add was\add* far from me.
That which is far off , and exceeding deep , who can find it out ?

I applied mine heart to know , and to search , and to seek out wisdom , and the reason \add of things\add*, and to know the wickedness of folly , even of foolishness \add and\add* madness :\f + \fr 7.25 \ft I applied…: Heb. I and mine heart compassed\f*

And I find more bitter than death the woman , whose heart \add is\add* snares and nets , \add and\add* her hands \add as\add* bands : whoso pleaseth God shall escape from her; but the sinner shall be taken by her.\f + \fr 7.26 \ft whoso…: Heb. he that is good before God\f*
Behold , this have I found , saith the preacher , \add counting\add* one by one , to find out the account :\f + \fr 7.27 \ft counting…: or, weighing one thing after another, to find out the reason\f*
Which yet my soul seeketh , but I find not: one man among a thousand have I found ; but a woman among all those have I not found.
Lo , this only have I found , that God hath made man upright ; but they have sought out many inventions.
